title: Teknisk problemlösare / DevOps
description:
**Omfattning:** Heltid.
  
**Varaktighet:** Tills vidare.
  
Car.info tillämpar provanställning.
  
  

Vill du arbeta i ett teknikdrivet bolag där utveckling, data och prestanda står i centrum? Car.info söker nu en DevOps Engineer som vill vara med och vidareutveckla en modern SaaS-plattform i en miljö där teknikval och förbättringsarbete drivs nära utvecklingsteamet.
  
I rollen arbetar du nära utvecklare och produktteam för att säkerställa stabila, skalbara och effektiva lösningar. Du blir en viktig del i att förbättra utvecklingsflöden, automatisera processer och skapa en robust infrastruktur där systemen är snabba, tillgängliga och driftsäkra.
  
Det är viktigt att förtydliga att detta inte är en renodlad DevOps-roll. Rollen är bred och innehåller flera tekniska ansvarsområden där DevOps är en del av helheten. Arbetet innefattar även utveckling och tekniskt förbättringsarbete, där PHP förekommer som en naturlig del av vardagen. Rollen passar därför dig som trivs i en varierad teknisk roll och uppskattar att arbeta brett, snarare än att enbart fokusera på DevOps.
  
Kvalifikationer
  
Erfarenhet av DevOps eller liknande teknisk roll
  
Erfarenhet av CI/CD och automatiserade deployprocesser
  
Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (AWS, Azure eller GCP)
  
Erfarenhet av containerteknologier som Docker och Kubernetes
  
Erfarenhet av scripting eller programmering (exempelvis Bash eller Python)
  
Erfarenhet av PHP är ett krav
  
God förståelse för systemarkitektur, prestanda och skalbarhet
  
Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
  

Meriterande
  
Erfarenhet av övervakning och loggning (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK)
  
Infrastructure as Code
  
Erfarenhet från SaaS- eller produktbolag
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter
  
Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines
  
Automatisera utvecklings-, test- och distributionsprocesser
  
Hantera och optimera molninfrastruktur
  
Bidra till utveckling och underhåll av system där PHP ingår
  
Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, prestanda och säkerhet i systemen
  
Samarbeta nära utvecklingsteam för effektiva leveranser
  
Identifiera och driva tekniska förbättringar i plattformen
  
  

Företaget erbjuder
  
Car.info är ett teknikdrivet och snabbt växande bolag med bas i Ängelholm. De utvecklar smarta SaaS-lösningar med fokus på användarvänlighet, prestanda och kundnytta. Här kombineras ett modernt arbetssätt med hög teknisk kompetens och stort affärsdriv.
  
Central roll i ett växande företag med höga ambitioner
  
Möjlighet att påverka både teknik och produktutveckling
  
Delaktighet i tekniska beslut och förbättringsarbete
  
Kort väg från idé till beslut – snabba och synliga resultat
  
Direkt feedback från användare och möjlighet att påverka produkten i realtid
  
En utvecklarvänlig arbetsmiljö med fokus på innovation, kvalitet och samarbete
  
  

Förmåner
  
Marknadsmässig lön (med möjlighet för årlig bonus).
  
5 veckors semester (6 veckor för dig som fyllt 40) med ytterligare intjänad semesterdag vartannat år.
  
Centralt kontor i vackra Ängelholm.
  
Möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån 2 dagar i veckan.
  
Ett härligt team av kollegor.
  
Gratis kaffe/frukt/läsk, måndagsfrukost och fredagsfika
  
  

Denna rekrytering är i samarbete med rekryteringsföretaget Happy Group. Happy Group ansvarar, projektleder och behandlar alla ansökningar
  
  

Ansökan
  
Är du redo att bli en del av vårt team?
  
  

**Skicka ditt CV och personliga brev till:**  

JC@happygroup.se
  
  

**Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av:**  

melvin@happygroup.se
  
Urval sker löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan

title: Scrum Master - Sales & Service Value Stream
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.  

  

As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.
Background
Are you ready to empower teams, drive digital transformation, and make a real impact at a global industrial leader? Alfa Laval is seeking a passionate Scrum Master to join our high-performing team - part of our dynamic digital organization reshaping how we deliver value to customers worldwide. At Alfa Laval, we’re on a transformative digital journey. With over 500 digital professionals across the globe, we’re advancing product lifecycle management, configuration, and supply chain capabilities. Our ambition: deliver the right solutions to our customers - faster, smarter, and more sustainably.
Since 2021, we’ve embraced the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), fostering agile mindsets across every part of our business. Now, we’re deepening this transformation, building collaborative teams that learn, adapt, and grow together.
About the Team and Your Role
You’ll join a skilled team of 14 professionals - including developers, testers, a Product Owner, and an Azure DevOps specialist. The team operates in a hybrid setup, with most members based in Lund, Sweden. As our new Scrum Master, you’ll be at the heart of a mature, collaborative, and driven team. You’ll facilitate agile ways of working, nurture a culture of continuous improvement, and help the team excel in delivering high-quality solutions. You’ll partner closely with the Product Owner and the development team - removing obstacles, supporting incident management, and enabling smooth, value-driven delivery. This role is hybrid and based in Lund, Sweden (2–3 days per week onsite required).
Key Responsibilities:* Guide the team’s progress towards sprint and project goals
* Organize and facilitate agile ceremonies (daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, etc.)
* Encourage pragmatic, people-first agile adoption (not just ‘by the book’)
* Support the Product Owner in backlog management and incident tracking
* Foster collaboration within the team and across value streams, especially as we integrate with major projects
* Coordinate with other Scrum Masters and participate in ART (Agile Release Train) events and ceremonies


Who You Are* People-oriented, open-minded, and genuinely passionate about Scrum Master area of responsibilities
* 1–3 years of recent, hands-on Scrum Master experience (ideally with cross-functional teams)
* Experience in IT delivery or software development is a plus, as is a background in Azure DevOps
* Familiar with SAFe and agile ceremonies, but flexible - adapting practices to what works best for the team
* Strong communicator and facilitator, able to navigate a complex, global organization
* Eager to learn, grow, and help your team succeed
* Experience in manufacturing or data-driven environments is nice to have, but not required


For Unions information in Sweden, please contact:  

Monica Anderberg, Unionen, at Monica.Anderberg@alfalaval.com  

Johan Ranhög, Akademikerna at Johan.Ranhög@alfalaval.com  

Stefan Sandell, Ledarna at Stefan.Sandell@alfalaval.com
We are conducting a continuous review of the applications received.
We accept applications by March 5th, 2026 (please note, we may close the process earlier if a suitable candidate is found).
We do not accept applications via email, due to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioural traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games. Playing the games is mandatory.  

  

As part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and secure workplace, we conduct background checks on final candidates for this role.
We look forward to receiving your application!
company_description: Alfa Laval is a leading global supplier of products and solutions for heat transfer, separation and fluid handling through our key products – heat exchangers, separators, pumps and valves.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Kreditz is transforming how businesses assess credit and risk using real-time data and NextGen Credit Scoring solutions.*

*As one of Europe’s fastest-growing FinTech scaleups - we’ve earned a place on the* ***Sifted 100: Nordics & Benelux*** *list in both 2024 and 2025 and most recently, we were proud to receive a* ***double win at the Credit Management & Compliance Awards 2025****, being named both "****Fintech Rocket of the Year****" and "****Breakthrough of the Year****".*

 *With strong growth across the Nordics and Europe, our clients range from leading banks and iGaming giants to fast-moving digital innovators.*

**ABOUT THE POSITION**  

Kreditz is looking for a **DevOps Engineer** to join our Tech team. In this role, you will build and evolve our cloud infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, and platform tooling, ensuring our systems are scalable, reliable, and secure as we grow.


This is a hands-on builder role for someone who enjoys automation, ownership, and turning complexity into clean, scalable infrastructure.

**WHAT CAN KREDITZ OFFER**

* A once-in-a-lifetime growth journey, from startup to Global scaleup  


	+ A journey where *everyone* in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, driven, and passionate colleagues who support each other’s success
* A culture that celebrates progress, humility, and teamwork  


	+ We win *together*
* 24/7 access to gym, sauna and sports facilities at our office, plus additional wellness allowance
* Competitive base salary

**RESPONSIBILITES**


Some of the main responsibilities you will cover:

* Design, build, and maintain cloud infrastructure using **Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).**
* Develop and optimize CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment.
* Build and deploy services on AWS using **ECS, Fargate, and Service Connect.**
* Implement and maintain monitoring, alerting, and observability solutions.
* Collaborate with developers to improve deployment workflows and platform reliability.
* Work with serverless technologies (**Lambda**) for event processing and automation.
* Perform code reviews and contribute hands-on to infrastructure projects.
* Leverage **AI agents and tools** to enhance development workflows and productivity.
* Document infrastructure architecture, processes, and runbooks.

  

Success means engineers ship confidently, systems scale without drama, and incidents are rare, visible, and quickly resolved.

**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**


We believe that you have:

* A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* **5+ years** of experience in DevOps, platform engineering, or backend development.
* Strong skills in Infrastructure as Code (**Terraform**).
* Experience with AWS services, particularly **ECS, Fargate, and Service Connect.**
* Experience with CI/CD tools and pipeline automation.
* Familiarity with containerization (**Docker/Podman**).
* Familiarity with message queuing (**SQS, SNS**).
* Experience with databases like **PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, DynamoDB.**
* Strong skills in monitoring and observability tools (**CloudWatch, OpenTelemetry, X-Ray**).
* Proficiency with **Git** and version control workflows.
* Scripting skills in **Python, Bash, or Go.**
* **Excellent English** communication skills *(Swedish is a plus).*
* Enthusiasm for using **AI agents and tools** in daily development work.
* *Experience in FinTech is a plus.*

**WHY JOIN NOW?**


At Kreditz, you'll have the opportunity to work in a cutting-edge, fast-growing FinTech company that's redefining the credit scoring industry. With the backing of major investors and a clear vision for the future, your work will make a real impact on financial inclusion worldwide. Join us and be a part of something truly transformative!

**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**


Q1/Q2 2026

**SCOPE**


Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)

**SALARY**


Competitive salary

**REPORTING**


You will be reporting to the company’s VP Engineering

**WORKPLACE**


Danderyd, Stockholm

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**


Ongoing selection, we review candidates continuously.  

*Last day for applications 31st March 2026*

**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**


As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract

 **CONTACT**


Lorenzo Puccio, VP Strategic Operations, Lorenzo@kreditz.com


For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our Co-founder/CTO, arlen@kreditz.com

title: Cloud Architect who loves mentoring and leading? Come and play!
description:
Finding a Cloud Architect who actually enjoys the human side of tech is a bit like finding a unicorn that also knows how to (and *wants* to!) lead the herd. You need the high-level vision to design the map, as well as the willingness to pick up a compass and lead the way through the skies.


At some companies, "Architect" is a title for someone who sits in an ivory tower and hands down diagrams from on high. That’s not us.


We’re looking for a Cloud Architect who loves mentoring and leading someone who still gets a buzz from opening an IDE and showing the team how it's done.


You are the vital link between big-picture business strategy and the daily "how-to." You aren't just designing the blueprint; you’re on-site with the crew, translating complex business needs into actionable features and sprints.

**The 75/25 Split (Give or Take)**  

We believe the best leaders are those who stay sharp. You can expect a minimum of 50% hands-on engineering work. Not because you "need" to, beacause you actually want to.

* The Easy Days: You’re building, deploying, and mentoring.

* The "Consultancy" Days: Some clients need a bit more hand-holding. When the going gets tough, you might shift to a 50/50 split, balancing deep-dive engineering with stakeholder coordination and expectation management.
### **What you'll do**

* Driving the Ship: This isn't an administrative role. You are a Team Lead in every sense; guiding project delivery from concept to "it's alive!"
* Translating "Tech" to "Human": You’ll be chatting with Directors and Engineering Managers one hour, and pair-programming with a dev the next. You need to speak both languages fluently
* Managing the Vibe: You know how to manage people and expectations in a clear, friendly and inclusve manner. We value autonomy, proactivity, and, most importantly, being someone people actually enjoy working with

### **Who are you?**


Tech has probably been a vital form of interest in your life, and you might have started out tinkering with games, or solving problems by creating technical solutions, or maybe just had that mind-set sayin "I want to to know how and why it works!".


You might have started of your career in sw development, system engineering or as DevOps and somewhere along the way you also learned that you have an interest in leading/mentoring people.


You would probably describe yourself as:

**Technically Senior:** You’ve been around the cloud block. You have the seniority to back up your decisions and the competence to earn the team's respect

**Project-Driven:** You’ve got a track record of driving projects across the finish line, not just riding in the passenger seat

**A Proactive Type:** You don’t wait for a ticket to tell you something is broken. You see a gap, you fill it

**Tech Skills:**

* Architectural-level competence required in at least one of the three hyperscalers: AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
* Infrastructure as Code
* CI/CD experience with automated code deployment
* Container orchestration
* Observability tools
* Configuration management

**Bonus:**


Development experience in languages like Go or Python is beneficial for understanding developer experience, automation, and infrastructure as code

**Buzzword bingo:**


AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Terraform, Pulumi, SDK, ArgoCD, GitHub Actions, Kubernetes, Grafana, Datadog, CloudWatch, Ansible, Go, Python, Docker

### **Language requirement**


Fluency in Swedish is a very-nice-to-have and English is a must. Why? Because *most* of our collaborations and client projects are conducted in Swedish

### **Welcome to Playground!**


At Playground, you work on real, complex assignments for well-established and ambitious clients, not bench projects or short-lived experiments. Our teams are trusted with production systems, platforms, and data that actually matter. Here growth comes from ownership, curiosity, and doing the work properly. You’re trusted to think, contribute, and keep getting better, one meaningful step at a time.


Playground brings together specialized domains under one umbrella, with a shared culture and way of working, and easy access to broad technical expertise when it helps move the work forward.


Buzz: Product Development, PO, SRE, Site Reliability Engineer, Team Lead, Consultant, Konsult, Data Engineer, Systemutvecklare, SW Engineer, Backend Developer, DevOps, Sverige, Stockholm, Amazon Web Services, SW Architecture, Cloud Lead

title: Testledare – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en testledare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 50-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
  
  

**Du har utbildning på kandidatnivå och erfarenhet av:**  

Test och testledning
  
Ta fram teststrategier
  
Testautomatisering (minst 1 år)
  
Agila metoder
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Testautomationsverktyg (som Selenium, Cypress, Katalon, Postman, Soap-UI, pytest)
  
CI/CD-verktyg (som Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
ISTQB-certifiering eller andra certifieringar som SAFe, ScrumMaster
  
Versionshantering (som Git)
  
Kunskap inom mordern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som kubernetesplattformar)
  
  

**Du får:**  

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
  
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
  
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
  
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
  
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
  
Arbeta på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, enligt Great Place to Work 2022!
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Testledare – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Engineering Manager - Retention
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We are looking for an Engineering Manager to lead a team of engineers building internal tooling and third party integrations that keep players engaged. The Retention team powers the organisation with communication capabilities, ranging from indirect and direct communication with the players to a custom-built toolbox that enriches the player journey with bonuses, loyalty programs, and seamless cross-channel experiences. As one of the most crucial parts of the player lifecycle, the Retention domain ensures our players return for new, exciting, and rewarding experiences.
We’re driven by excellence and fueled by innovation. Now we’re looking for someone who wants to be part of that journey. You will be responsible for overseeing the daily operations, driving technical execution, and supporting team growth across the whole employee lifecycle - hiring & developing talent.  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:*** Lead and mentor the engineering team, driving growth, performance, and career development
* Manage technical delivery, including code reviews, system health, and incident resolution
* Plan and execute sprints, roadmaps, and project deliverables with clear timelines
* Optimize CI/CD pipelines, DevOps practices, and overall development processes
* Ensure the team delivers high-quality releases through effective oversight of testing, automation, and collaboration with QA
* Track and act on engineering KPIs, reporting progress and risks to stakeholders
* Collaborate across engineering, product, and QA teams to achieve goals
* Contribute to engineering strategy, SDLC improvements, and stakeholder communication

  

**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**

ESSENTIAL SKILLS* Solid engineering background
* Proven experience in leading and managing engineering teams
* Transparent and inspiring leadership style that builds trust
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to guide and challenge teams effectively when needed
* Deep understanding of Agile software development methodologies



NICE TO HAVES* Experience in retention or user engagement domain
* Knowledge of the iGaming industry

  

**WHO WE ARE**

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 2000 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 19 offices worldwide.  

**BENEFITS**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner

title: Data Scientist, Sweden - BCG X
description:
Who We Are


Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.  

  

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

 **We Are BCG X**

  

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

  

What You'll Do


Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We are looking for dedicated individuals with a passion for data science, statistics, operations research and redefining organizations into AI led innovative companies. Successful candidates possess the following:* Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
* Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
* Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
* Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
* Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
* Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
* Have strong project management skills

  

What You'll Bring

**TECHNOLOGIES:**

  

Programming Languages: Python

  

#BCGXjob

  

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
  

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Software Engineer (Optimizely, Stockholm)
description:
Har du ett intresse för att skapa tekniska lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad? Vill du vara med och skapa nästa generations teknik och bygga den digitala framtiden? Vi söker dig som vill bidra med din kompetens i projekt för några av världens största varumärken och som gärna håller dig uppdaterad inom .NET-utveckling och Optimizely.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som .NET-utvecklare inom Optimizely/Episerver på Capgemini kommer du att vara en del av ett agilt utvecklingsteam som utvecklar affärskritiska lösningar för våra kunder. Du arbetar med moderna teknologier och tjänster från Microsoft och andra ledande aktörer, vilket ger dig en framtidssäkrad kompetens och möjlighet att växa inom breda och aktuella teknikområden.
   

  

*I rollen kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att:*
* Arbeta i framkant med testdriven utveckling och principer för clean coding.
* Delta i hela utvecklingsprocessen, från kravanalys och design till utveckling, test och leverans.
* Bidra till nyskapande och affärskritiska projekt för våra kunder.
* Samarbeta med kollegor både i Sverige och internationellt i en agil miljö.


**Din profil**
 Vi letar efter någon med minst 4 års .NET-erfarenhet, om följande tekniker låter intressanta för dig vill vi gärna höra från dig:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Optimizely CMS (tidigare Episerver) samt intresse för Optimizely Commerce
* Goda kunskaper i C#, .NET Core, MVC .NET 6 och Azure.
* Erfarenhet av Azure cloud, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure CI/CD pipelines, Service Bus och REST APIs.
* Intresse eller erfarenhet av relevanta tekniker som: MS SQL Server, Angular, React, Vue och WCAG 2.2.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy.
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar.
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring & tjänstepension.


**Ansökan**
 Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan. Vi kommer att intervjua löpande och ser fram emot att hitta vår nästa kollega. Varmt välkomna med din ansökan!
   

  

*Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller genomförs som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en AI-driven global partner för affärs- och tekniktransformation som levererar konkret verksamhetsnytta. Vi formar framtiden för organisationer och förverkligar den med hjälp av AI, teknik och människor. Med vår starka historia på nästan 60 år är vi en ansvarsfull och mångsidig koncern med 420 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Genom vår expertis inom strategi, teknik, design, ingenjörstjänster och affärsverksamhet levererar vi heltäckande tjänster och lösningar, baserade på vår djupa branschkunskap och vårt omfattande partnernätverk. Koncernen rapporterade globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro för 2024.
   

  

**Make it real** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Build / DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Build/DevOps Engineer with a passion for optimizing developer workflows and ensuring seamless CI/CD processes.
   

  

**The position:**
 You will be focusing on a high-impact project to reduce friction and improve clarity within our CI/CD pipelines. This role is crucial for our Tech Foundations team, addressing critical capacity needs and ensuring our developers receive fast, reliable, and actionable feedback from our build systems. You will play a pivotal role in boosting developer efficiency and accelerating game development across the studio.
   

  

**Who you are:**
* Proven expertise as a Build/DevOps Engineer, specifically with complex CI/CD systems.
* Previous experience within the gaming industry.
* Strong understanding of CI/CD infrastructure, tooling, and operational pipelines.
* Passionate about improving developer experience and workflow efficiency.
* Skilled in diagnosing complex issues and identifying root causes within CI/CD environments.
* Collaborative and able to work effectively with internal engineering teams and stakeholders.
* Committed to delivering clear documentation and effective knowledge transfer.


**Comfortable working in our tech stack:**
* Jenkins (Groovy, Jenkins pipeline)
* Perforce version control
* Python
* Golang (Used in backend applications)
* Game platform SDKs (Playstation, Xbox, Steam etc)
* Grafana / Zabbix


**What you’ll do:**
* Design and implement improvements to CI/CD system feedback, logging, and error reporting.
* Identify common failure patterns and introduce mechanisms for quick root cause determination.
* Implement targeted enhancements to CI/CD pipelines, tooling, and supporting infrastructure.
* Maintain a healthy CI/CD pipeline, acting on and recovering from pipeline errors to unblock engine development.
* Collaborate closely with Tech Foundations engineers and relevant stakeholders to align changes with existing standards.
* Produce clear documentation and guidance to ensure improvements are adopted and maintainable long-term.


**Other Details:**
 Start: ASAP to 1 month
   

  

 Length: 6 months with possibility to extend
   

  

 Workplace: Stockholm 3 days onsite.

title: Data Platforms & DevOps Engineer
description:
**About Tether** 




 Tether enables EV charging operators (CPOs) to earn new revenue from flexibility/balancing markets and through e-credits, without extra complexity. We’re working with several clients, close to our first market qualification in Sweden, and expanding across the Nordics and selected EU markets.
 



  





**Role summary** 




 We are looking for a hybrid Data & DevOps Engineer to manage our end-to-end data lifecycle. You will not only maintain the cloud infrastructure but also build and optimize the ingestion engines that feed our Databricks Lakehouse. A key part of this role involves interacting with REST APIs, managing serverless ingestion (AWS Lambda), and ensuring data quality from the moment it hits S3.
 



  





  





  





**Key responsibilities** 



* **IaC & security hardening** 
 - expand our AWS infrastructure using Terraform or CloudFormation. You will implement rigorous security measures, including VPC peering/PrivateLink for Databricks, KMS encryption at rest, and IAM least-privilege policies.
* **API ingestion & engineering** 
 - build and maintain Python-based ingestion services. You will manage API authentication, handle rate limiting, and ensure efficient data partitioning in S3.
* **CI/CD evolution** 
 - scale our GitHub Actions workflows to handle multi-environment deployments (Dev/Sandbox/Prod) for both cloud infrastructure (Glue and Kinesis) and Databricks DLT pipelines.
* **Spark performance & optimization** 
 - monitor and tune Spark configurations (shuffling, partitioning, caching) to ensure our DLT and AutoLoader pipelines run efficiently.
* **MLOps support** 
 - partner with Data Scientists to automate ML model deployments, managing feature store integrations and model serving infrastructure.
* **Security & governance** 
 - implement SSE-KMS encryption, IAM policies, and lifecycle rules to ensure our data lake is compliant and cost-effective.
* **Observability & monitoring** 
 - build a "single pane of glass" using CloudWatch and Datadog. You’ll create dashboards that track pipeline latency, AutoLoader costs, and system health.
* **Documentation & knowledge transfer** 
 - produce high-quality architectural diagrams and runbooks. You aren't just building, you are mentoring the internal team to ensure long-term operational success.



  





**Requirements** 



* **AWS** 
**Serverless** 
 : Hands-on with Lambda, EventBridge, SQS, SNS, and S3.
* **Databricks** 
 : Experience with Delta Live Tables (DLT), AutoLoader, and Unity Catalog.
* **DevOps** 
 : Proficient in GitHub Actions and Terraform.
* **Monitoring** 
 : Hands-on experience with Datadog and CloudWatch Logs/Metrics.
* **Languages** 
 : Strong Python (for Lambda/PySpark) and SQL (for data validation/modelling).
* **Data** 
**prep** 
 : Knowledge of AWS Glue (Catalog/ETL) and Kinesis Firehose is a major plus.



  





  





  





**Compensation & structure** 



* Competitive salary appropriate for an early-stage European startup.
* Company equity



  





  





  





 ⚡Join Tether for…
 


* A central role in defining how EV charging flexibility is sold in Europe
* Direct collaboration with the management team on product, data, and cloud infrastructure
* High autonomy, fast decision cycles, and meaningful equity/ownership discussions for the right profile



  





**Apply by sending an email to general@tetherev.io with the subject line “Application to Data Platforms & DevOps Engineer position”, including your CV and a brief intro about yourself.**

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
Ansök nu
   

  

* Urval sker löpande
* Stockholm
* Arbete på plats


 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

**Drifta andras val eller forma din egen vardag? (Bli en del av vårt nya team)**
 Du har jobbat några år nu. Du är antagligen den i ditt nuvarande team som alltid tjatar om att "vi borde automatisera det där", men möts av gamla processer och färdiga mallar. Det är tryggt, men trångt.
   

  

 Men handen på hjärtat: Vill du bara följa kartan, eller vill du vara med och rita den?
   

  

 På Forefront satsar vi nu vidare. Vi bygger upp ett
 **helt nytt team** 
 inom GCP Infrastructure & Application Modernization. Vi söker dig som vill vara med från startskottet. Du kliver inte in i en "färdig maskin" – du får vara med och sätta standarden för hur vi jobbar, vilka verktyg vi väljer och vilken kultur vi skapar.
   

  

**Rollen: En nyckelspelare från dag ett**
 Som En Av De Första På Plats i Den Här Satsningen Blir Din Röst Viktig. Du Lämnar "Click-Ops" Bakom Dig Och Fokuserar På Hantverket
   

  

* Infrastructure as Code: Du bygger och underhåller miljöer med Terraform.
* Containerisering: Du hjälper till att flytta applikationer till GKE eller Cloud Run.
* Automatisering: Du sätter upp CI/CD-pipelines som gör att utvecklarna kan sova gott om natten.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Din verktygslåda**
 Vi tror att du har cirka 3 års erfarenhet av moln och utveckling.
   

  

* Teknik: Du har bra koll på GCP (eller AWS/Azure och vill byta). Du behärskar scripting (Python/Bash) och grunderna i Kubernetes.
* Inställningen: Du lockas av tanken på att bygga något nytt. Du är en "doer" som hellre testar och lär dig än väntar på instruktioner.


**Vad får du? (WIIFM)** 
 Varför lämna tryggheten? För att få vara med på en resa där du inte bara är ett anställningsnummer. Hos oss får du en brant utvecklingskurva, budget för certifieringar och chansen att forma din egen roll i ett växande team.
   

  

**Kaffe före CV?** 
 Vi bryr oss mer om vart du är på väg än exakt vad du gjorde 2019. Känner du igen dig i Framåtrörelsen?
   

  

 Låt oss ta en kaffe och snacka om hur vi bygger framtidens team. Ansök nu eller hör av dig direkt!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Kreditz is transforming how businesses assess credit and risk using real-time data and NextGen Credit Scoring solutions.*
*As one of Europe’s fastest-growing FinTech scaleups - we’ve earned a place on the* 
***Sifted 100: Nordics & Benelux***
*list in both 2024 and 2025 and most recently, we were proud to receive a* 
***double win at the Credit Management & Compliance Awards 2025***
*, being named both "* 
***Fintech Rocket of the Year***
*" and "* 
***Breakthrough of the Year***
*".*
*With strong growth across the Nordics and Europe, our clients range from leading banks and iGaming giants to fast-moving digital innovators.*
**About The Position**
 Kreditz is looking for a
 **DevOps Engineer** 
 to join our Tech team. In this role, you will build and evolve our cloud infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, and platform tooling, ensuring our systems are scalable, reliable, and secure as we grow.
   

  

 This is a hands-on builder role for someone who enjoys automation, ownership, and turning complexity into clean, scalable infrastructure.
   

  

**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* A once-in-a-lifetime growth journey, from startup to Global scaleup
* A journey where everyone in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, driven, and passionate colleagues who support each other’s success
* A culture that celebrates progress, humility, and teamwork
* We win together
* 24/7 access to gym, sauna and sports facilities at our office, plus additional wellness allowance
* Competitive base salary


**RESPONSIBILITES**
**Some Of The Main Responsibilities You Will Cover**
* Design, build, and maintain cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
* Develop and optimize CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment.
* Build and deploy services on AWS using ECS, Fargate, and Service Connect.
* Implement and maintain monitoring, alerting, and observability solutions.
* Collaborate with developers to improve deployment workflows and platform reliability.
* Work with serverless technologies (Lambda) for event processing and automation.
* Perform code reviews and contribute hands-on to infrastructure projects.
* Leverage AI agents and tools to enhance development workflows and productivity.
* Document infrastructure architecture, processes, and runbooks.


 Success means engineers ship confidently, systems scale without drama, and incidents are rare, visible, and quickly resolved.
   

  

**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
**We Believe That You Have**
* A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 5+ years of experience in DevOps, platform engineering, or backend development.
* Strong skills in Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
* Experience with AWS services, particularly ECS, Fargate, and Service Connect.
* Experience with CI/CD tools and pipeline automation.
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker/Podman).
* Familiarity with message queuing (SQS, SNS).
* Experience with databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, DynamoDB.
* Strong skills in monitoring and observability tools (CloudWatch, OpenTelemetry, X-Ray).
* Proficiency with Git and version control workflows.
* Scripting skills in Python, Bash, or Go.
* Excellent English communication skills (Swedish is a plus).
* Enthusiasm for using AI agents and tools in daily development work.
* Experience in FinTech is a plus.


**WHY JOIN NOW?**
 At Kreditz, you'll have the opportunity to work in a cutting-edge, fast-growing FinTech company that's redefining the credit scoring industry. With the backing of major investors and a clear vision for the future, your work will make a real impact on financial inclusion worldwide. Join us and be a part of something truly transformative!
   

  

**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 Q1/Q2 2026
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Competitive salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s VP Engineering
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 Ongoing selection, we review candidates continuously.
   

  

*Last day for applications 31st March 2026*
**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**
 As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, VP Strategic Operations, Lorenzo@kreditz.com
   

  

 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our Co-founder/CTO, arlen@kreditz.com
   

  

 Intelligent credit- & risk decisions made easy with open banking & AI-technology

title: Cloud Engineer (DevOps Engineer) IRC286893
description:
**Description**
 Our client is working with solutions to help improve health and care.
   

  

**Requirements**
 5+ years of experience in cloud infrastructure engineering or DevOps roles.
   

  

 Proven success in building and maintaining automation pipelines.
   

  

 In-depth knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) and Configuration-as-Code practices.
   

  

 Hands-on experience with Git, scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Python), and major hyperscalers.
   

  

 Operational experience in cloud networking (VPC, subnets, load balancers, DNS) and HTTPS/TLS.
   

  

 Fluency in English and Swedish to effectively communicate with customers and internal teams.
   

  

 Sincere interest in healthcare technology and operational excellence.
   

  

 A knack for working collaboratively in a fast-paced, production environment.
   

  

**Fluent Swedish language**
 Job responsibilities
   

  

 Design scalable infrastructure using cloud platforms and Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) to ensure high reliability.
   

  

 Automate deployment and operational processes using Configuration-as-Code (YAML, JSON, XML) for consistency and efficiency.
   

  

 Implement monitoring and observability solutions to proactively detect and resolve system issues.
   

  

 Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to enable reliable software delivery.
   

  

 Collaborate with development teams to embed reliability and scalability into software design.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**Culture of caring.** 
 At GlobalLogic, we prioritize a culture of caring. Across every region and department, at every level, we consistently put people first. From day one, you’ll experience an inclusive culture of acceptance and belonging, where you’ll have the chance to build meaningful connections with collaborative teammates, supportive managers, and compassionate leaders.
   

  

**Learning and development.** 
 We are committed to your continuous learning and development. You’ll learn and grow daily in an environment with many opportunities to try new things, sharpen your skills, and advance your career at GlobalLogic. With our Career Navigator tool as just one example, GlobalLogic offers a rich array of programs, training curricula, and hands-on opportunities to grow personally and professionally.
   

  

**Interesting & meaningful work.** 
 GlobalLogic is known for engineering impact for and with clients around the world. As part of our team, you’ll have the chance to work on projects that matter. Each is a unique opportunity to engage your curiosity and creative problem-solving skills as you help clients reimagine what’s possible and bring new solutions to market. In the process, you’ll have the privilege of working on some of the most cutting-edge and impactful solutions shaping the world today.
   

  

**Balance and flexibility.** 
 We believe in the importance of balance and flexibility. With many functional career areas, roles, and work arrangements, you can explore ways of achieving the perfect balance between your work and life. Your life extends beyond the office, and we always do our best to help you integrate and balance the best of work and life, having fun along the way!
   

  

**High-trust organization.** 
 We are a high-trust organization where integrity is key. By joining GlobalLogic, you’re placing your trust in a safe, reliable, and ethical global company. Integrity and trust are a cornerstone of our value proposition to our employees and clients. You will find truthfulness, candor, and integrity in everything we do.
   

  

**About GlobalLogic**
 GlobalLogic, a Hitachi Group Company, is a trusted digital engineering partner to the world’s largest and most forward-thinking companies. Since 2000, we’ve been at the forefront of the digital revolution – helping create some of the most innovative and widely used digital products and experiences. Today we continue to collaborate with clients in transforming businesses and redefining industries through intelligent products, platforms, and services.

title: Sr System & Cloud Engineer
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we're looking for a Senior System and Cloud Engineer to join our Cloud Platform team. In this role, you will join our mission to enable product teams by providing a secure, reliable, observable, and self-service platform that empowers developers across the organization. If you're passionate about building platforms that enable engineering teams to move faster, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Oversee load balancers, Global Server Load Balancing (GSLB) equipment, Content Delivery Network (CDN) platforms, and troubleshoot client/server issues.
* Handle proactive and reactive outages, work with vendors, and take ownership of network incidents, escalations, and root cause analysis.
* Lead backbone network design and architecture for on-premises and public cloud migration, and build hybrid connectivity solutions.
* Work with business unit leadership, product managers, and customers to develop project objectives, timelines, and feature requirements.
* Support network system availability, manage network capacity, and ensure compliance with Information Security standards.
* Deploy equipment, manage SSL certificate hosting and renewal, and build infrastructure for data centers and cloud environments.
* Implement and continually improve operational procedures, systems, and network engineering best practices.
* Offer on-call support, monitor infrastructure and hosted services, and troubleshoot complex issues.
* Manage and influence global teams, provide guidance and support, and mentor team members in areas of expertise.
* Communicate incident impacts, risks, and mitigation plans to executives, document incident information, and create network engineering documentation and best practices.


**Minimum Qualifications:**
* Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience and a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
**Meet our Team**
 In this role, you’ll join our Cloud Platform team - a group of seven engineers from around the world who bring diverse perspectives to our work. Our culture emphasizes knowledge sharing, blameless post-mortems, and collective ownership of our platform’s success. We’re eager to grow with engineers who take initiative on complex infrastructure challenges and are passionate about building self-service tools that empower fellow engineering teams.
   

  

**You Day-to-Day**
 As a Senior System and Cloud Engineer
 **,** 
 you will develop and maintain tools to support product teams build and deliver solutions quickly and reliably. Additionally, you will design, set up, and codify best practices and processes to manage infrastructure and resources.
   

  

 In this role, you will get the opportunity to:
   

  

* Drive architectural decisions and ensure that the system architecture satisfies the needs of all the stakeholders and key system quality attributes.
* Govern the infrastructure, resources and accounts in AWS
* Ensure that Compliance and Security standards are adhered to.
* Actively contribute and demonstrate healthy modern engineering practices.
* Drive projects and implementations within our team’s areas of responsibility.
* Participate in the on-call rotation for the team to ensure 24/7 availability of our services.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Advanced knowledge on Linux, networking, databases
* Experienced with AWS Cloud.
* Are versed in container orchestration (Kubernetes or ECS).
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, Cloud formation, AWS CDK
* A solid expertise in CI/CD systems. We primarily use GitHub Actions and CircleCI.
* Programming background (preferably Python, Golang or Bash).
* Conforming to best practices in Cybersecurity eg: IAM, WAF, DDoS
* Are familiar with distributed systems


**Get bonus points if you also have…**
* Experience with Java or Kotlin and related frameworks
* Worked with PCI-DSS compliant infrastructures.
* Experience with observability tools such as Datadog, Splunk


**We Believe in You**
 Interested in knowing more? Don't hesitate to apply and/or let's talk – we'd love to get to know you!

title: DevOps-Specialist
description:
Är du vår nästa DevOps-Specialist? Vill du vara med på resan mot ett än mer elektrifierat Sverige? Då kan det här vara tjänsten för dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten** 
 I rollen som DevOps-specialist arbetar du med att automatisera och effektivisera utvecklings- och driftsprocesser för IT-system som stödjer kraftsystemanalys, driftplanering och utvecklingen av det svenska kraftsystemet. Rollen kombinerar operativt arbete med utveckling av arbetssätt, där fokus ligger på stabila, säkra och reproducerbara leveranser i en verksamhetskritisk miljö.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär bland annat att du:
   

  

* Automatiserar konfigurationshantering och driftsättning av applikationer
* Installerar och konfigurerar system på ett reproducerbart och säkert sätt
* Stöttar utvecklingsteam vid driftsättning, konfiguration och felsökning
* Bygger, förbättrar och förvaltar CI/CD-pipelines
* Arbetar med loggning, monitorering och observerbarhet
* Samarbetar med systemansvariga, utvecklingsteam, plattform, infrastruktur och IT-säkerhet


 Du får möjlighet att vara med och forma DevOps-arbetet i en sektion där rollen är ny inom teamet. Organisationen är under tillväxt och det finns utrymme att påverka både tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som DevOps-specialist tillhör du enheten Analysapplikationer B inom avdelningen IT för Kraftsystem & Elmarknad. Enheten ansvarar för systemstöd som används för analys, planering och drift av det svenska kraftsystemet och elmarknaden. Du arbetar tillsammans med systemansvariga i ett team som ansvarar för inköpta system samt att stödja de tvärfunktionella utvecklingsteamen.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav**
 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, strukturerad och resultatorienterad, med god samarbetsförmåga. Du tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och arbetar metodiskt för att driva arbete framåt. Egenskaperna är viktiga då rollen innebär arbete med automatisering samt nära samarbete med systemansvariga, utvecklingsteam och andra IT-funktioner.
   

  

 Du ska också leva upp till den statliga värdegrunden. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare har du en examen inom IT eller annan relevant utbildning, eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt som Svenska kraftnät bedömer som likvärdig.
   

  

 Du har även flerårig erfarenhet av:
   

  

* IT-infrastruktur, exempelvis operativsystem, containerplattformar, databaser, lagring, nätverk och säkerhetslösningar
* Driftsättning och felsökning på Linux och/eller Windows av applikationer skrivna i till exempel C++, C# och/eller Python
* Automatisering av konfiguration med till exempel Ansible
* Skriptprogrammering med till exempel Bash, Powershell och/eller Python
* Konfiguration av monitorering, observerbarhet, logghantering med till exempel OP5, Loki, Grafana och/eller Prometheus
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Containers och orkestrering, exempelvis Docker, Kubernetes eller Podman
* CI/CD-verktyg såsom Azure DevOps, GitLab, Argo CD, Artifactory, JFrog Xray eller SonarQube
* Systemutveckling eller testautomatisering i C++, C# eller Python
* Arbete i miljöer med höga IT-säkerhetskrav
* Arbete i agila team, gärna i en ledande teknisk roll


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm / Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 2026-03-03 Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidaretjänst
* I denna rekryteringsprocess tillämpas tester
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Sandra Peiper, sandra.peiper@adadigital.se eller linda.segerman@adadigital.se. Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Anna Maria Hedman, 010-489 26 71, (AnnaMaria.Hedman@svk.se). Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010-475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll, ST, 010-475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Service Manager IT Security Operations (SecOps)
description:
emagine is seeking a Service Manager for a client within the construction industry to strengthen for its IT Security Operations (SecOps) function. The role is responsible for managing day-to-day security operations, coordinating with Service Managers across Digital Workplace, Cloud, and On-Premises environments, and ensuring the consistent and effective delivery of security services.
   

  

**Start: 2026-03-02**
**End: 2026-09-30**
**Location: Stockholm, 2-3 days/ week at the office.**
**About the assignment:**
 The assignment aims to improve operational efficiency, establish structured vulnerability management practices, and drive initiatives that enhance the organization’s overall security posture. The Service Manager will collaborate closely with internal teams and external suppliers to align processes, manage security incidents, support compliance requirements (particularly ISO 27001), and lead continuous improvement efforts.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Coordinate daily SecOps activities and ensure smooth service delivery.
* Establish and maintain structured processes for vulnerability management.
* Strengthen collaboration across Digital Workplace, Cloud, and On-Premises service areas.
* Initiate and drive improvements to the organization’s overall security posture.
* Integrate DevOps practices into security operations where relevant.
* Provide regular reporting and status updates to stakeholders on security operations, improvements, and compliance activities.


**Required Competence And Experience**
* Leading or managing security operations in medium to large organizations.
* Vulnerability management, incident management, and log management.
* Microsoft security technologies and detection services.
* Coordinating cross-functional teams across infrastructure, cloud, and workplace environments.
* Driving initiatives that improve security maturity and operational effectiveness.
* Supporting and implementing compliance frameworks within IT SecOps, particularly ISO 27001.


**Required Skills (Must Have)**
* Strong expertise in the Microsoft security ecosystem (e.g., Defender suite, Sentinel, Entra ID).
* Experience with detection and monitoring platforms (SIEM / SOAR).
* Hands-on experience with vulnerability management tools and processes.
* Understanding of DevOps principles and their application within SecOps.
* Familiarity with ISO 27001 controls and compliance activities.
* Excellent communication in Swedish and English, coordination, and stakeholder management skills.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and incident management capabilities.


**Preferred Qualifications (Nice To Have)**
* Experience in cloud security, particularly Azure and/or multi-cloud environments.
* Knowledge of additional regulatory or compliance frameworks (e.g., NIST, GDPR).
* Experience with ITIL or formal service management frameworks.
* Understanding of OWASP, secure development practices, or application security.
* Experience working in multinational or distributed organizational environments.

title: Test Software Engineer
description:
Do you thrive on turning complex software into something rock-solid and reliable? If you’re keen to build a test automation that keeps products fast, stable and ready for our customers – every single release – this could be your next step!
   

  

**Why Sandvik Coromant?**
 With us, your work shapes digital solutions used by manufacturers worldwide. Join a team that values curiosity, craft, and continuous improvement. We offer you:
   

  

* Impact that reaches real users in modern manufacturing.
* Time to learn, experiment, and grow your skills.
* A friendly, inclusive culture with support from day one.


**Your mission**
 You embed quality into every single stage of development – pairing with developers and product managers, translating requirements into smart test strategies, and making sure each release meets expectations. Automation sits at the heart of your work; build and maintain frameworks, integrate them into CI/CD, and track results to prevent regressions before they happen. You also help teams reproduce issues and validate fixes, keeping feedback loops short and constructive.
   

  

 Tech environment you work with:
   

  

* C#/.NET and Angular in a modern codebase.
* Test frameworks and tools like Cypress, Selenium, xUnit or NUnit.
* CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.
* API, functional, regression and performance testing across front-end and back-end services.


**Location and flexibility**
 This is a hybrid role based at Sandviken or Stockholm, with a mix of on-site collaboration and remote work.
   

  

**Your profile**
 Bringing a couple years of hands-on software experience, you’re comfortable moving between code and tests and you understand how quality scales in modern delivery. You have a degree in Computer Science or a related field or the equivalent experience. What helps you succeed:
   

  

* Solid programming skills in C#/.NET and experience with Angular.
* Proficiency with test automation (e.g., Cypress, Selenium, xUnit/NUnit)
* Familiarity with CI/CD (Azure, DevOps or GitHub Actions) and QA methodologies.
* Experience covering APIs and performance as part of your strategy.


 Curious, collaborative, and calm under pressure are features that describe you well. You ask questions, challenge assumptions and turn insights into actionable tests. Ownerships come naturally, your communication is clear and learning fast is part of your routine.
   

  

**Some Words About Your New Team**
 We’re a cross-functional group that partners closely with developers and product managers, championing testability and modern QA practices so teams ship confidently and customers get dependable software. Our missions is simple: make quality an everyday habit – through automation, smart tooling, and continuous improvement that keeps product reliable at scale.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Marko Stugbäck, hiring manager, at +46 (0)70-626 60 95
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contact in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts (Sweden):
   

  

* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Tord Engström, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)76 106 62 87
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


 Recruitment Specialist: Hanna Thomas
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than March 8th, 2026. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0088584.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com

title: OSS Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will play a crucial role in designing, optimizing, and supporting Business Support Systems (BSS) and Operations Support Systems (OSS) for the telecommunications industry.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key role in:*
* Leading the Design, Architecture, and Implementation of BSS and OSS platforms to support telecom operations.
* Ensuring Seamless Integration of BSS systems with OSS platforms
* Monitoring System performance, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing enhancements to optimize efficiency.
* Conducting Business process analysis to identify automation and optimization opportunities, aligning technical solutions with business objectives.
* Leading or participating in OSS-related projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* Coordinating with BSS/OSS vendors and service providers for system upgrades, bug fixes, and support.
* Maintaining detailed documentation of BSS-OSS configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.


**Your profile**
* Strong expertise in BSS/OSS Architecture, Design, and implementation.
* Hands-on experience with Billing, CRM, Order management, Revenue assurance, and service provisioning systems.
* Proficiency in System integration, Troubleshooting, and Performance optimization.
* Familiarity with Telecom operations, Regulatory compliance, and industry best practices.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Data Architect
description:
At Sandvik Coromant, analytics is about enabling smarter choices across our business. Right now, our Data & AI team is expanding, and this role plays a key part in shaping how insights are created, trusted and used every day.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As Data Architect, you shape our data strategy by translating business needs into well‑designed, scalable, and secure data solutions. You guide product teams, set engineering standards, and ensure our data community thrives through strong principles, best practices, and reliable technical foundations. Working closely with Product Owners, platform teams, and engineers, you create architecture that supports autonomy, quality, and cost‑efficiency across our data products.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Define data models, schemas, and integration flows that strengthen our analytical capabilities.
* Act as the primary technical contact for Product Owners on requirements and validation.
* Coach data engineers and support the broader data community through standards, reviews, and technical leadership.
* Partner with the Platform Team to establish engineering guidelines around compliance, security, and efficiency.
* Provide third‑level operational support and monitoring for data products within assigned domains.


**Location and flexibility**
 This position is based in Sandviken or Stockholm and offers a hybrid working model, combining office and remote work.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have several years of experience in data engineering and have led or guided others in modern data environments. You’re comfortable with cloud technologies and agile product‑team setups, and you strengthen the team by coaching, mentoring, or leading development work in an environment where collaboration and iteration guide the way.
   

  

 You have experience with:
   

  

* Lakehouse technologies, preferably Databricks.
* Microsoft Azure services.
* Business Intelligence technologies, ideally Power BI.
* DevOps practices, such as CI/CD and infrastructure as code.


 You’re a strong communicator who easily turns complex technical topics into clear messages for both engineers and stakeholders. You coach and guide others, fostering collaboration and best practices across the data community. You think strategically and understand how architecture decisions impact long‑term business value. With a proactive, solution‑oriented mindset, you handle challenges effectively and ensure high-quality, secure and reliable data solutions.
   

  

**Our culture**
 Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Anton Peters, Head of Data and AI, at anton.peters@sandvik.com
